course.subject: HART
course.name: Devised Theatre: Contemporary Creative Process for Performance
course.description: Contemporary Theatre has developed to take on many forms beyond naturalistic drama, including Dance Theatre, Multimedia Theatre, Physical Theatre, Site-Specific Theatre and more new forms are constantly emerging. These exciting forms of theatre are often created with the method called Devised Theatre which is a highly collaborative and experimental way of making theatre pieces. It is widely adopted by many contemporary theatre groups of different scales and styles all over the world. In Devised Theatre, all participants work together to create a performance, on a theme of their choice, by making use of various starting materials including photos, objects, songs, news articles, maps, letters, poems, creative writings, movements and even architectural space. In this course, students will become creative performers who will create, edit, design and perform a short piece of original theatre work.

reviews.author: pandababy7
reviews.comment_content:
Similar to the content description of the course above.
Very fruitful, basically some introduction to improvisation, its origin and application, different types of theatre and the tools they use.
In the first 10 minutes of class, we usually watched some videos related to the course content and waiting for the late students.
Then came the warm-up part. Usually some body movements and group activities, which are relaxing.
After that, we have time to do the group practices for some exercise given in each class. Normally some short performance using different devising or performing skills. The class size is small, and the group division for in-class exercise(not the final performance) is different every time so you could meet and cooperate with new people.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Acty TANG is very helpful I would say. He is passionate and willing to help, with adequate knowledge in his teaching area, and always had his ways to help students relax and enjoy the class.
BTW, his accent is quite good compared to some UST professors........

reviews.comment_workload:
It should be very light.
You only need to attend the class for attendance and participation.

Occasionally the instructor would give you some after-class searching hw, but you can complete it in 10 minutes. Very easy and it's ok even if you don't do it .

The only countable workload comes from the final performance, students need to form groups weeks before and self-direct and perform a play that lasts for 10-15 minutes. The instructor would give you time in class for practice. But if you want to do it well, you also need to arrange some time for after-class practice.

However, due to the social unrest this semester, the final performance was replaced by an alternative essay, adding some workload to the final weeks.
